intro: Scrophularia rupestris var. libanotica, commonly known as the Lebanese rockscrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the rocky regions of the Middle East. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving on limestone and rocky soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh, dry conditions.
